dek: What jobs are you physically willing to do?

first_question.text: Which of the following describes something that is required for your job?

story.text: This circle represents an occupation that has similar physical requirements to yours. Each dot inside the circle represents about 50,000 people who do that job.
These are other jobs with similar requirements. ↑ Some of them pay more. ↓ Some of them pay less.
← The jobs on the left side have very different physical demands from yours.
In the space between the jobs ← different from yours and similar to yours → is every other job in America.
Welcome to the Atlas of Jobs. This is what people physically have to do to earn money in modern-day America, compared to what you do. And we can see some clear trends.

story.hl: Percent of workers, without the ability to pause work
story.text: For example, these are the jobs that lack control over when they can take a break. These people have to work through being tired or needing to use the restroom.

story.hl: Percent of day where standing is required, mean
story.text: This is the percentage of the workday people are required to stand.

story.hl: Percent of workers, choice of sitting or standing is allowed
story.text: This is who has a choice of sitting or standing.

story.hl: Percent of workers, exposed to wetness
story.text: And this is who is exposed to wetness, whether that is water, sewage, or bodily fluids.
Explore the atlas. Use the pulldown below to highlight people who are required to perform certain tasks.
